findings.title: Division before multiplication causes precision loss
findings.description: The share calculation divides before multiplying: assets / totalAssets * totalShares. With integer division, small deposits relative to totalAssets round down to zero.
findings.impact: Zero-share deposits still add assets to vault, inflating share price. Attacker can exploit this to extract value.
findings.recommendation: Always multiply before dividing: assets * totalShares / totalAssets

findings.title: Missing zero-shares check in depositVulnerable
findings.description: The function accepts deposits that result in zero shares, allowing donation attacks.
